alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 7:23PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas and northwestern Elbert Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 723 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Parker to 3 miles south of Elizabeth, or along a line extending from 16 miles southeast of Denver to 32 miles north of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Parker, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Ponderosa Park and The Pinery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
